It seems to be mining, and the block height does not match the block hash

This is my start command
```
docker run --rm --name ethereum-testnet -it -d \
   -v ${PWD}/data/testnet:/root/.ethereum \
   -p 30304:30303 \
   -p 18545:8545  \
    ethereum/client-go:v1.10.3 \
   --http.addr 0.0.0.0 \
   --ropsten \
   --http.api "admin,debug,eth,miner,net,personal,shh,txpool,web3" \
   --http
```
Even if I delete all the data and re-sync, it still works

I think it's saner to just sync up first without mining and only enable mining afterwards.
Ah, wait, you didn't enable mining. Ok, I see. You opened up your node to the internet and somebody probably started mining with it. Please never open your RPC publicly for everyone.

> Ah, wait, you didn't enable mining. Ok, I see. You opened up your node to the internet and somebody probably started mining with it. Please never open your RPC publicly for everyone.

Thank you, I am going to close the rpcport now
